subject: p10523725
History: Year old man with cough, sob, wheezing, hypotension, r/o pna.
Impression: Thickening of the pleural margins in the abnormal contour of the left heart border oral due to fat deposition. Lungs are reasonably well expanded and clear. Heart is probably top normal size but there is no pulmonary vascular engorgement, mediastinal venous engorgement, edema or any pleural effusion. The thoracic aorta is generally tortuous, but not focally aneurysmal.
